Posts.Content: Thinking of you and your anxious wait for results.  It's hard I know. You will find strength you didn't know you had, you probably already have. Hope tomorrow is manageable for you and one step closer on your journey to recovery.
Posts.Title: Awaiting breast biopsy results

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear of your worries Jane but thank you for your reply. From your answer I can deduce that if they do need to go in they can use a guide wire ultrasound then to locate cells. I wasn't aware of that. Hope everything is OK for you. It's hard isn't it. I had bowel cancer last year so I do understand a bit of what you're going through.  Hugs. Xxx

Posts.Content: I will ask the specialist when I get my results I was just wondering if it had happened to anyone else.  They did xray me and that's when they discovered they couldn't find it. Thank you for your reply. It's appreciated.  Hope all ok with you @justlittleme.

Posts.Content: Oh so I'm not the only one. I'm just concerned that if I do require surgery they won't know where to go. Thanks for your reply.  It's appreciated.  Hope all ok with you @Carolyn28
Posts.Title: Titanium marker

Posts.Content: Wondered whether you might know the answer to this?  Last June I was diagnosed with bowel cancer.  Now after a mammogram Pretty_cancerous cells have been found. yesterday I had them vacuumed out. They then insert a titanium marker incase they need to go back in again and remove more. They put the marker in,  at least they thought they had but then did THREE xrays and couldn't find it so it probably didn't go in. Do you know whether this will matter or Not? IM not seeing specialist for a couple of weeks so can't ask anyone. They said it had never happened before. I was also a bit worried to have three xrays instead of just one. If they do need to go back in they won't know where?
Posts.Title: Titanium marker
